description: From Middle English meritorious, borrowed between 1375 and 1425 from Latin meritōrius (“earning money”), from meritus, past participle of mereō (“to earn”).

adjectives.description: meritorious (comparative more meritorious, superlative most meritorious)

entries.meaning: Deserving of merit or commendation; deserving reward.
examples: The policeman received the Award of Meritorious Service from his grateful department.
